column3: Name: “Table 1 of 1 on page 105 of 124”
Table: 97
Capital Improvement Plan
DESCRIPTION
The Hampton Public Safety Center will be constructed on six
acres located behind Fire Station 9 and adjacent to the
softball fields inside Briarfield Park. This new facility will
enable the division to provide training to personnel at one
primary location.
Relocate the City's current traffic control center to a more
stable building on the Public Works Operations Center
grounds. At present, the traffic control center, which contains
a large quantity of expensive electronics, is housed in an
office trailer.
Satellite fueling station with canopy (part of new EOC and
Fire Station project off of Big Bethel Road).
TOTAL: New Facilities
Purchase and customize the exteriors of two (2) 24-
passenger buses and one (1) 42-passenger bus to be used
to support activities and demand for services
An automated Vehicle Locating System would allow
managers in Public Works to track service vehicles and
dispatch them more efficiently. Service vehicles would
include Solid Waste vehicles, snow plows, street sweepers,
wastewater clean out vehicles and other similar type
applications.
Public Works Traffic presently has over 64 miles of fiber optic
cable in the City. Most of it is located on utility poles and by
agreement with these utilities, it is used exclusively for traffic
purposes. This project would relocate the fiber optic cable in
3 key areas of the City from overhead poles to underground
conduit locations. This will allow its use for purposes other
than traffic.
